H0.text: The Aviva Sports Stadium is in which European country. England

H2.text: The Aviva Sports Stadium is in which European country. Wales

H3.text: The Aviva Sports Stadium is in which European country. Airlan

A4.text: Aviva Stadium, formerly Lansdowne Road (Irish: Bóthar Lansdún, IPA: [ˈbˠoːhəɾˠ ˈl̪ˠan̪ˠsˠd̪ˠuːnˠ]) and also known as the Dublin Arena (during UEFA competitions), is a sports stadium located in Dublin, Ireland.

A5.text: Dublin Arena open for business UEFA.com, 14 May 2010

A6.text: During the redevelopment of the Lansdowne Road stadium in 2007–2010, international rugby and soccer were played there.

A7.text: Geographic data related to Ireland at OpenStreetMap

A9.text: The Aviva Stadium was a joint venture between the Irish Rugby Football Union, the FAI and the Government.

A10.text: The Aviva Stadium was developed as a joint venture involving the Irish Rugby Football Union, the FAI and the Government.
